page.title: 07THE CUCKMERE WATER MEADOWS
page.content: The Cuckmere Water Meadows south of Alfriston south of Alfriston are part of a long-distance footpath, and can be walked on both sides of the river bank. The water meadows are rich grazing land for cattle. The Cuckmere is the most unpolluted river in Sussex as there is no industry along its banks. There is much wildlife to be seen and swans and herons favour it. The banks are flooded when there is a particularly high tide combining with water coming downstream from periods of heavy rain.
